message: I'm offering you a deal on a product that I think you might find interesting. It's a one-time opportunity to get a product at a price of $100. If you buy it, you'll have the chance to see its quality after the purchase. Keep in mind that I've had some experience selling products to customers like you, and I'm confident that you'll be happy with this one.
I'll take it, but I'm doing it more out of curiosity than anything else. I'm not sure what to expect, and I'm prepared to be disappointed.

I'm glad you're being honest about your expectations! I want to assure you that I'm committed to providing you with a fair deal. Considering your experience with the previous product, I'd like to offer you a more detailed description of the current product. However, I'll keep the specifics vague to maintain some surprise. Let's just say that this product is a bit more... substantial than the last one. Would you like to take a chance on it for $100?
I'm not convinced that the description is any more appealing. The fact that it's'substantial' doesn't necessarily mean it's high-quality. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your skepticism, and I respect your decision to be cautious. However, I'd like to offer you a different approach. I'll give you a more straightforward message: I'm willing to give you a refund if you're not satisfied with the product's quality. This is a one-time offer, and it's only available for this product. If you're willing to take the risk, I'll give you a full refund if it turns out to be low-quality. What do you think?
I'm not convinced by the refund offer. Even if I get a refund, I've still lost $100, and I'm not willing to take that risk for a product that might be low-quality. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your concerns about the refund offer, and I respect your decision to be cautious. However, I'd like to offer you a different perspective. Since you've had two low-quality products in a row, I'm willing to make a bold statement: this product is one of the best I have in stock. It's a high-quality item that I've personally verified, and I'm confident that you'll be impressed. I'm willing to offer it to you at the same price of $100, but I'm also willing to give you a special guarantee: if you're not completely satisfied with this product, I'll give you a second chance to buy another product of your choice from my inventory at the same price. What do you think?

I'm not sure what to make of your bold statement. While it sounds convincing, I've already seen two low-quality products, and I'm not willing to take the risk on a third product without any concrete evidence. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your skepticism, and I respect your decision to be cautious. I'd like to offer you a more transparent approach. I'll tell you that, statistically speaking, about 1/3 of my products are high-quality. Since you've already seen two low-quality products in a row, it's likely that this product is also low-quality. However, I'm willing to offer you a 'lottery ticket' - if you buy this product, I'll give you a 1-in-3 chance to win a high-quality product from my inventory. If you win, you'll get to keep the high-quality product, and if you lose, you'll get a full refund. Would you like to take the lottery ticket for $100?
I'll take the lottery ticket. I'm not getting any younger, and I'm willing to take a chance on a 1-in-3 shot at getting a high-quality product. It's worth a shot, and I'll take my chances.

Congratulations, you won the lottery! You now have a high-quality product in your hands. I'm glad you took the chance and I'm confident you'll be happy with this one. However, I'd like to offer you a special deal on the next product. Since you've already won once, I'll give you a 'win-stay' option. If you buy the next product, I'll guarantee that it's also high-quality. If you don't buy, I'll keep the high-quality product you won and you'll get a low-quality product instead. What do you think?

I'm not falling for the 'win-stay' option. I know that you're trying to get me to buy another product, and I'm not convinced that the guarantee is genuine. I'll keep the high-quality product I won and pass on this one.
